00039 #include <limits.h>
00040 #include <mpi.h>
00041 #include <stdio.h>
00042 #include <stdlib.h>
00043 #include <string.h>
00044 #include <sys/types.h>
00045 #include <asm/types.h>
00046 #include <sys/stat.h>
00047 #include <fcntl.h>
00048 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
00049 #include <unistd.h>
00050 #include <time.h>
00051 #include <errno.h>
00052 #include <lustre/lustre_user.h>
00053 #include "lp_utils.h"
00054 
00055 #define LPGL_BUF_LEN 8192
00056 #define LPGL_TEST_ITEMS 12
00057 
00058 #define MIN_GLHOST 5
00059 
00060 #define MAX_WAIT_TRIES            10
00061 #define WAIT_TIME                  1  /* secs */
00062 #define ONE_MB               1048576  /*   1 MB */
00063 #define MIN_LGBUF_SIZE     536870912  /* 512 MB */
00064 #define MAX_LGBUF_SIZE     536870912  /* 512 MB */
00065 // #define MAX_LGBUF_SIZE    1073741824  /*   1 GB */
00066 
00067 #define READ    1
00068 #define WRITE   2
00069 #define IOCTL   3
00070 #define CLOSE   4
00071 
00072 int rank = 0;
00073 int size = 0;
00074 
00075 char *testdir = NULL;
00076 int   only_test;
00077 
00078 char  buf[LPGL_BUF_LEN];
00079 char *lgbuf;
00080 int   lgbuf_size;
00081 char  filename[MAX_FILENAME_LEN];
00082 char  errmsg[MAX_FILENAME_LEN+20];
00083 
00084 static void
00085 alloc_lgbuf()
00086 {
00087 
00088         if (lgbuf)
00089                 return;
00090 
00091         lgbuf_size = MAX_LGBUF_SIZE;
00092         for (; lgbuf_size >= MIN_LGBUF_SIZE; lgbuf_size -= ONE_MB)
00093                 if ((lgbuf = (char *)malloc(lgbuf_size)) != NULL)
00094                         return;
00095 
00096         FAIL("malloc of large buffer failed.\n");
00097 }
00098 
00099 static inline void
00100 read_buf(int fd)
00101 {
00102         int pos, rc;
00103 
00104         rc = read(fd, buf, sizeof(buf));
00105         if (rc == -1) {
00106                 pos = lseek(fd, 0, SEEK_CUR);
00107                 sprintf(errmsg, "read of file %s at pos %d for %zu bytes "
00108                         "returned %d: (%d) %s.\n",
00109                         filename, pos, sizeof(buf), rc, errno, strerror(errno));
00110                 FAIL(errmsg);
00111         } else if (rc != sizeof(buf)) {
00112                 pos = lseek(fd, 0, SEEK_CUR);
00113                 sprintf(errmsg, "read of file %s at pos %d for %zu bytes "
00114                         "returned %d.\n",
00115                         filename, pos, sizeof(buf), rc);
00116                 FAIL(errmsg);
00117         }
00118 }
00119 
00120 static inline void
00121 write_buf(int fd, int index)
00122 {
00123         int pos = index * sizeof(buf);
00124         int rc;
00125 
00126         memset(buf, index, sizeof(buf));
00127         lseek(fd, pos, SEEK_SET);
00128         rc = write(fd, buf, sizeof(buf));
00129         if (rc == -1) {
00130                 sprintf(errmsg, "write of file %s at pos %d for %zu bytes "
00131                         "returned %d: (%d) %s.\n",
00132                         filename, pos, sizeof(buf), rc, errno, strerror(errno));
00133                 FAIL(errmsg);
00134         } else if (rc != sizeof(buf)) {
00135                 sprintf(errmsg, "write of file %s at pos %d for %zu bytes "
00136                         "returned %d.\n",
00137                         filename, pos, sizeof(buf), rc);
00138                 FAIL(errmsg);
00139         }
00140 }
00141 
00142 /*
00143  * task0 attempts GR(gid=1) -- granted immediately
00144  * task1 attempts PR|PW -- blocked, goes on waiting list
00145  * task2 attempts GR(gid=1) -> should be granted
00146  * task2 writes to file and releases GR(gid=1)
00147  * task0 waits for task2 to complete its processing
00148  * task0 writes to file and releases GR(gid=1)
00149  * task1 PR|PW should be granted and reads the file
00150  */
00151 void grouplock_test1(char *filename, int fd, int blocking_op, int unlock_op)
00152 {
00153         MPI_Request req1, req2;
00154         int iter, flag1, flag2, temp1, temp2;
00155         int i, rc, gid = 1;
00156 
00157         if (rank == 0) {
00158                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_LOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00159                         sprintf(errmsg,
00160                                 "ioctl GROUP_LOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00161                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00162                         FAIL(errmsg);
00163                 }
00164         }
00165 
00166         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00167 
00168         switch (rank) {
00169         case 1:
00170                 if (blocking_op == WRITE) {
00171                         write_buf(fd, rank);
00172                         lseek(fd, 0, SEEK_SET);
00173                 }
00174 
00175                 for (i = 0; i <= 2; i++)
00176                         read_buf(fd);
00177 
00178                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00179                 break;
00180         case 2:
00181                 /* Wait for task1 to progress. This could be racey. */
00182                 sleep(WAIT_TIME);
00183 
00184                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_LOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00185                         sprintf(errmsg,
00186                                 "ioctl GROUP_LOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00187                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00188                         FAIL(errmsg);
00189                 }
00190 
00191                 write_buf(fd, rank);
00192 
00193                 if (unlock_op == CLOSE)
00194                         rc = close(fd);
00195                 else
00196                         rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_UNLOCK, gid);
00197 
00198                 if (rc == -1) {
00199                         sprintf(errmsg,
00200                                 "%s release GROUP_LOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00201                                 (unlock_op == CLOSE) ? "close" : "ioctl",
00202                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00203                         FAIL(errmsg);
00204                 }
00205                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00206                 break;
00207         case 0:
00208                 /* PR|PW task will tell us when it completes */
00209                 MPI_Irecv(&temp1, 1, MPI_INT, 1, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req1);
00210                 /* 2nd locking task will tell us when it completes */
00211                 MPI_Irecv(&temp2, 1, MPI_INT, 2, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req2);
00212 
00213                 /* Wait for task2 to complete. */
00214                 iter = MAX_WAIT_TRIES;
00215                 do {
00216                         iter--;
00217                         if (!iter) {
00218                                 FAIL("2nd locking task is not progressing\n");
00219                         }
00220 
00221                         sleep(WAIT_TIME);
00222 
00223                         MPI_Test(&req1, &flag1, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00224                         if (flag1) {
00225                                 FAIL("PR|PW task progressed even though GROUP "
00226                                      "lock is held\n");
00227                         }
00228 
00229                         MPI_Test(&req2, &flag2, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00230                 } while (!flag2);
00231 
00232                 /* Make sure task1 is still waiting. */
00233                 iter = MAX_WAIT_TRIES;
00234                 do {
00235                         iter--;
00236                         sleep(WAIT_TIME);
00237                         MPI_Test(&req1, &flag1, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00238                         if (flag1) {
00239                                 FAIL("PR|PW task progressed even though "
00240                                      "GROUP lock is held\n");
00241                         }
00242                 } while (iter);
00243 
00244                 write_buf(fd, rank);
00245 
00246                 /* Now we need to release the lock */
00247                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_UNLOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00248                         sprintf(errmsg,
00249                                 "ioctl GROUP_UNLOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00250                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00251                         FAIL(errmsg);
00252                 }
00253 
00254                 /* Wait for task1 to complete. */
00255                 iter = MAX_WAIT_TRIES;
00256                 do {
00257                         iter--;
00258                         if (!iter) {
00259                                 FAIL("PR|PW task is not progressing even "
00260                                      "though GROUP lock was released\n");
00261                                 break;
00262                         }
00263                         sleep(WAIT_TIME);
00264                         MPI_Test(&req1, &flag1, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00265                 } while (!flag1);
00266 
00267                 break;
00268         }
00269 }
00270 
00271 /*
00272  * task0 attempts GR(gid=1) -- granted immediately
00273  * task1 attempts GR(gid=2) -- blocked
00274  * task2 attempts PR|PW -- blocked
00275  * task3 attempts GR(gid=2) -- blocked
00276  * task4 attempts GR(gid=1) -- should be granted
00277  * task0,4 writes to file and releases GR(gid=1) --
00278  *       this allows task2 & 3's GR locks to be granted; task4 remains blocked.
00279  * task1 & 3 write to file and release GR(gid=2)
00280  * task2 PR|PW should be granted and reads the file.
00281  */
00282 void grouplock_test2(char *filename, int fd, int blocking_op, int unlock_op)
00283 {
00284         int i, iter, rc, gid = 1;
00285         int flag1, flag2, flag3, flag4;
00286         int temp1, temp2, temp3, temp4;
00287         MPI_Request req1, req2, req3, req4;
00288 
00289         if (rank == 0) {
00290                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_LOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00291                         sprintf(errmsg,
00292                                 "ioctl GROUP_LOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00293                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00294                         FAIL(errmsg);
00295                 }
00296         }
00297 
00298         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00299 
00300         switch (rank) {
00301         case 3:
00302                 /* Wait for task2 to issue its read request. */
00303                 sleep(2*WAIT_TIME);
00304         case 1:
00305                 gid = 2;
00306                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_LOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00307                         sprintf(errmsg,
00308                                 "ioctl GROUP_LOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00309                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00310                         FAIL(errmsg);
00311                 }
00312 
00313                 write_buf(fd, rank);
00314 
00315                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00316 
00317                 /* Do not release the locks until task 0 is ready to watch
00318                    for reading task only */
00319                 MPI_Recv(&temp1, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
00320                          MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00321 
00322                 if (unlock_op == CLOSE)
00323                         rc = close(fd);
00324                 else
00325                         rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_UNLOCK, gid);
00326                 if (rc == -1) {
00327                         sprintf(errmsg,
00328                                 "%s release GROUP_LOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00329                                 (unlock_op == CLOSE) ? "close" : "ioctl",
00330                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00331                         FAIL(errmsg);
00332                 }
00333                 break;
00334         case 2:
00335                 /* Give task1 a chance to request its GR lock. */
00336                 sleep(WAIT_TIME);
00337 
00338                 if (blocking_op == WRITE) {
00339                         write_buf(fd, rank);
00340                         lseek(fd, 0, SEEK_SET);
00341                 }
00342 
00343                 for (i = 0; i <= 3; i++)
00344                         read_buf(fd);
00345 
00346                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00347                 break;
00348         case 4:
00349                 /* Give task1 & 3 a chance to queue their GR locks. */
00350                 sleep(3*WAIT_TIME);
00351 
00352                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_LOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00353                         sprintf(errmsg,
00354                                 "ioctl GROUP_LOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00355                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00356                         FAIL(errmsg);
00357                 }
00358 
00359                 write_buf(fd, rank);
00360 
00361                 rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_UNLOCK, gid);
00362                 if (rc == -1) {
00363                         sprintf(errmsg,
00364                                 "%s release GROUP_LOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00365                                 (unlock_op == CLOSE) ? "close" : "ioctl",
00366                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00367                         FAIL(errmsg);
00368                 }
00369 
00370                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00371                 break;
00372         case 0:
00373                 /* locking tasks will tell us when they complete */
00374                 MPI_Irecv(&temp1, 1, MPI_INT, 1, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req1);
00375                 MPI_Irecv(&temp2, 1, MPI_INT, 2, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req2);
00376                 MPI_Irecv(&temp3, 1, MPI_INT, 3, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req3);
00377                 MPI_Irecv(&temp4, 1, MPI_INT, 4, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req4);
00378 
00379                 /* Make sure all tasks that should be blocked are waiting. */
00380                 iter = MAX_WAIT_TRIES;
00381                 do {
00382                         iter--;
00383                         sleep(WAIT_TIME);
00384                         MPI_Test(&req1, &flag1, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00385                         MPI_Test(&req2, &flag2, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00386                         MPI_Test(&req3, &flag3, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00387                         if (flag1 || flag3) {
00388                                 FAIL("GROUP (gid=2) task progressed even though"
00389                                      " GROUP (gid=1) lock is held.\n");
00390                         }
00391                         if (flag2) {
00392                                 FAIL("PR|PW task progressed even though "
00393                                      "GROUP (gid=1) lock is still held\n");
00394                         }
00395                 } while (iter);
00396 
00397                 /* Wait for task4 to signal it has completed. */
00398                 iter = MAX_WAIT_TRIES;
00399                 do {
00400                         iter--;
00401                         if (!iter) {
00402                                 FAIL("2nd task GROUP(gid=1) not progressing\n");
00403                         }
00404                         sleep(WAIT_TIME);
00405                         MPI_Test(&req1, &flag1, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00406                         MPI_Test(&req2, &flag2, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00407                         MPI_Test(&req3, &flag3, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00408                         MPI_Test(&req4, &flag4, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00409                         if (flag1 || flag3) {
00410                                 FAIL("GROUP (gid=2) task progressed even though"
00411                                      " GROUP (gid=1) lock is held.\n");
00412                         }
00413                         if (flag2) {
00414                                 FAIL("PR|PW task progressed even though "
00415                                      "GROUP (gid=1) lock is still held\n");
00416                         }
00417                 } while (!flag4);
00418 
00419                 write_buf(fd, rank);
00420 
00421                 /* Now let's release first lock */
00422                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_UNLOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00423                         sprintf(errmsg, "ioctl GROUP_UNLOCK of file %s "
00424                                 "returned %d", filename, rc);
00425                         FAIL(errmsg);
00426                 }
00427 
00428                 /* Wait for task1 & 3 to signal they have their lock. */
00429                 iter = MAX_WAIT_TRIES;
00430                 do {
00431                         iter--;
00432                         if (!iter) {
00433                                 FAIL("GROUP(gid=2) tasks not progressing\n");
00434                         }
00435                         sleep(WAIT_TIME);
00436                         MPI_Test(&req1, &flag1, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00437                         MPI_Test(&req2, &flag2, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00438                         MPI_Test(&req3, &flag3, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00439                         if (flag2) {
00440                                 fprintf(stderr, "task2 %d\n", flag2);
00441                                 FAIL("PR task progressed even though GROUP lock"
00442                                      " was on the queue task\n");
00443                         }
00444                 } while (!(flag1 && flag3));
00445 
00446                 /* Make sure task2 is still waiting. */
00447                 iter = MAX_WAIT_TRIES;
00448                 do {
00449                         iter--;
00450                         sleep(WAIT_TIME);
00451                         MPI_Test(&req2, &flag2, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00452                         if (flag2) {
00453                                 FAIL("PR task progressed even though GR(gid=2) "
00454                                      "lock was active.\n");
00455                         }
00456                 } while (iter);
00457 
00458                 /* Tell task1 & 3 to release their GR(gid=2) lock. */
00459                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 1, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00460                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 3, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00461 
00462                 /* Wait for task2 (PR) to complete. */
00463                 iter = MAX_WAIT_TRIES;
00464                 do {
00465                         iter--;
00466                         if (!iter) {
00467                                 FAIL("reading task is not progressing even "
00468                                      "though GROUP locks are released\n");
00469                                 break;
00470                         }
00471                         sleep(WAIT_TIME);
00472                         MPI_Test(&req2, &flag2, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00473                 } while (!flag3);
00474                 break;
00475         }
00476 }
00477 
00478 /*
00479  * Tests a bug that once existed in the group lock code;
00480  * i.e. that a GR lock request on a O_NONBLOCK fd could fail even though
00481  * there is no blocking GROUP lock ahead of it on the waitq.
00482  *
00483  * task0 starts a large write (PW). this test could be racey if this
00484  *       write finishes too quickly.
00485  * task1 attempts GR(gid=1) -- blocked
00486  * task2 attempts GR(gid=2) with a O_NONBLOCK fs. should not fail.
00487  */
00488 void grouplock_test3(char *filename, int fd)
00489 {
00490         MPI_Request req1, req2;
00491         int iter, flag1, flag2, temp1, temp2;
00492         int rc, gid = 1;
00493 
00494         if (rank == 0) {
00495                 alloc_lgbuf();
00496         } else if (rank == 2) {
00497                 rc = fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
00498                 if (rc == -1) {
00499                         sprintf(errmsg, "fcntl(O_NONBLOCK) failed: (%d) %s.\n",
00500                                 errno, strerror(errno));
00501                         FAIL(errmsg);
00502                 }
00503         }
00504 
00505         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00506 
00507         switch (rank) {
00508         case 2:
00509                 gid = 2;
00510                 usleep(10000);
00511                 usleep(10000);
00512         case 1:
00513                 /* Racey, we have to sleep just long enough for
00514                  * task0's write to start. */
00515                 usleep(10000);
00516 
00517                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_LOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00518                         sprintf(errmsg,
00519                                 "ioctl GROUP_LOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00520                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00521                         FAIL(errmsg);
00522                 }
00523 
00524                 /* tell task0 we have the lock. */
00525                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00526 
00527                 /* the close of fd will release the lock. */
00528                 break;
00529         case 0:
00530                 rc = write(fd, lgbuf, lgbuf_size);
00531                 if (rc == -1) {
00532                         sprintf(errmsg, "write of file %s for %d bytes "
00533                                 "returned %d: (%d) %s.\n",
00534                                 filename, lgbuf_size,
00535                                 rc, errno, strerror(errno));
00536                         FAIL(errmsg);
00537                 } else if (rc != lgbuf_size) {
00538                         sprintf(errmsg, "write of file %s for %d bytes "
00539                                 "returned %d.\n",
00540                                 filename, lgbuf_size, rc);
00541                         FAIL(errmsg);
00542                 }
00543 
00544                 /* GR tasks will tell us when they complete */
00545                 MPI_Irecv(&temp1, 1, MPI_INT, 1, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req1);
00546                 MPI_Irecv(&temp2, 1, MPI_INT, 2, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req2);
00547 
00548                 /* Wait for task1 & 2 to complete. */
00549                 iter = MAX_WAIT_TRIES;
00550                 do {
00551                         iter--;
00552                         if (!iter) {
00553                                 FAIL("GR(gid=1) tasks are not progressing even "
00554                                      "no conflicting locks exist.\n");
00555                                 break;
00556                         }
00557                         sleep(WAIT_TIME);
00558                         MPI_Test(&req1, &flag1, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00559                         MPI_Test(&req2, &flag2, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00560                 } while (!(flag1 && flag2));
00561                 break;
00562         }
00563 }
00564 
00565 /*
00566  * Tests a bug that once existed in the group lock code;
00567  * i.e. extent locks without O_NONBLOCK that go on the waitq before a group
00568  * lock request came in and was granted. The extent lock would timed out and
00569  * produce an error.
00570  *
00571  * task0 starts a large write (PW). this test could be racey if this
00572  *       write finishes too quickly.
00573  * task1 attempts PR -- blocked
00574  * task2 attempts GR(gid=1) -- blocked
00575  * task0 completes write
00576  * task1 should wakeup and complete its read
00577  * task2 should wakeup and after task1 complete.
00578  */
00579 void grouplock_test4(char *filename, int fd)
00580 {
00581         MPI_Request req1;
00582         int iter, flag1, temp1;
00583         int rc, gid = 1;
00584 
00585         if (rank == 0)
00586                 alloc_lgbuf();
00587 
00588         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00589 
00590         switch (rank) {
00591         case 1:
00592                 /* Racey, we have to sleep just long enough for
00593                  * task0's write to start. */
00594                 MPI_Recv(&temp1, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
00595                          MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00596                 usleep(10000);
00597                 usleep(10000);
00598 
00599                 /* tell task2 to go. */
00600                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 2, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00601 
00602 
00603                 read_buf(fd);
00604                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00605                 break;
00606         case 2:
00607                 /* Give task0 & 1 a chance to start. */
00608                 MPI_Recv(&temp1, 1, MPI_INT, 1, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
00609                          MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00610                 usleep(25000);
00611                 usleep(25000);
00612 
00613                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_LOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00614                         sprintf(errmsg,
00615                                 "ioctl GROUP_LOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00616                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00617                         FAIL(errmsg);
00618                 }
00619 
00620                 /* tell task0 we have the lock. */
00621                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00622 
00623                 /* Do not release the locks until task 0 tells us too.
00624                    for reading task only */
00625                 MPI_Recv(&temp1, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
00626                          MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00627 
00628                 rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_UNLOCK, gid);
00629                 if (rc == -1) {
00630                         sprintf(errmsg,
00631                                 "ioctl GROUP_UNLOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00632                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00633                         FAIL(errmsg);
00634                 }
00635                 break;
00636         case 0:
00637                 /* tell task1 to go to avoid race */
00638                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 1, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00639                 rc = write(fd, lgbuf, lgbuf_size);
00640                 if (rc == -1) {
00641                         sprintf(errmsg, "write of file %s for %d bytes "
00642                                 "returned %d: (%d) %s.\n",
00643                                 filename, lgbuf_size,
00644                                 rc, errno, strerror(errno));
00645                         FAIL(errmsg);
00646                 } else if (rc != lgbuf_size) {
00647                         sprintf(errmsg, "write of file %s for %d bytes "
00648                                 "returned %d.\n",
00649                                 filename, lgbuf_size, rc);
00650                         FAIL(errmsg);
00651                 }
00652 
00653                 /* wait for task2 to get its lock. */
00654                 MPI_Recv(&temp1, 1, MPI_INT, 2, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
00655                          MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00656 
00657                 /* Tell task2 it's ok to release its GR(gid=1) lock. */
00658                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 2, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00659 
00660                 /* wait a really long time. */
00661                 sleep(180 * WAIT_TIME);
00662 
00663                 /* PR task will tell us when it completes */
00664                 MPI_Irecv(&temp1, 1, MPI_INT, 1, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req1);
00665 
00666                 /* Make sure the PR task is successful and doesn't hang.
00667                  *
00668                  * XXX - To test properly we need to make sure the read
00669                  *       gets queued before task2's group lock request.
00670                  *       You may need to increase lgbuf_size.
00671                  */
00672                 iter = MAX_WAIT_TRIES;
00673                 do {
00674                         iter--;
00675                         if (!iter) {
00676                                 FAIL("PR task is hung !\n");
00677                                 break;
00678                         }
00679                         sleep(WAIT_TIME);
00680                         MPI_Test(&req1, &flag1, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00681                 } while (!flag1);
00682 
00683                 break;
00684         }
00685 }
00686 
00687 /*
00688  * task0 attempts GR(gid=1) -- granted
00689  * task1 attempts PR on non-blocking fd -> should return -EWOULDBLOCK
00690  * task2 attempts PW on non-blocking fd -> should return -EWOULDBLOCK
00691  * task3 attempts GR(gid=2) on non-blocking fd -> should return -EWOULDBLOCK
00692  */
00693 void grouplock_nonblock_test(char *filename, int fd)
00694 {
00695         MPI_Request req1, req2, req3;
00696         int iter, flag1, flag2, flag3, temp1, temp2, temp3;
00697         int rc, gid = 1;
00698 
00699         if (rank == 0) {
00700                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_LOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00701                         sprintf(errmsg,
00702                                 "ioctl GROUP_LOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00703                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00704                         FAIL(errmsg);
00705                 }
00706         }
00707 
00708         rc = fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
00709         if (rc == -1) {
00710                 sprintf(errmsg, "fcntl(O_NONBLOCK) failed: (%d) %s.\n",
00711                         errno, strerror(errno));
00712                 FAIL(errmsg);
00713         }
00714 
00715         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00716 
00717         switch (rank) {
00718         case 1:
00719                 rc = read(fd, buf, sizeof(buf));
00720                 if ((rc != -1) || (errno != EWOULDBLOCK)) {
00721                         FAIL("PR lock succeeded while incompatible "
00722                              "GROUP LOCK (gid=1) is still held\n");
00723                 }
00724 
00725                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00726                 break;
00727         case 2:
00728                 rc = write(fd, buf, sizeof(buf));
00729                 if ((rc != -1) || (errno != EWOULDBLOCK)) {
00730                         FAIL("PW lock succeeded while incompatible "
00731                              "GROUP LOCK (gid=1) is still held\n");
00732                 }
00733 
00734                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00735                 break;
00736         case 3:
00737                 gid = 2;
00738                 rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_LOCK, gid);
00739                 if ((rc != -1) || (errno != EWOULDBLOCK)) {
00740                         FAIL("GROUP_LOCK (gid=2) succeeded while incompatible "
00741                              "GROUP LOCK (gid=1) is still held.\n");
00742                 }
00743 
00744                 MPI_Send(&gid, 1, MPI_INT, 0, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00745                 break;
00746         case 0:
00747                 /* reading task will tell us when it completes */
00748                 MPI_Irecv(&temp1, 1, MPI_INT, 1, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req1);
00749                 /* writing task will tell us when it completes */
00750                 MPI_Irecv(&temp2, 1, MPI_INT, 2, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req2);
00751                 /* 2nd locking task will tell us when it completes */
00752                 MPI_Irecv(&temp3, 1, MPI_INT, 3, 1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req3);
00753 
00754                 iter = MAX_WAIT_TRIES;
00755                 do {
00756                         iter--;
00757                         if (!iter) {
00758                                 FAIL("non-blocking tasks are not progressing\n");
00759                         }
00760                         sleep(WAIT_TIME);
00761                         MPI_Test(&req1, &flag1, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00762                         MPI_Test(&req2, &flag2, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00763                         MPI_Test(&req3, &flag3, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
00764                 } while (!(flag1 && flag2 && flag3));
00765 
00766                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_UNLOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00767                         sprintf(errmsg, "ioctl GROUP_UNLOCK of file %s",
00768                                 filename);
00769                         FAIL(errmsg);
00770                 }
00771                 break;
00772         }
00773 }
00774 
00775 /* Just test some error paths with invalid requests */
00776 void grouplock_errorstest(char *filename, int fd)
00777 {
00778         int rc, gid = 1;
00779 
00780         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00781 
00782         switch (rank) {
00783         case 0:
00784                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_LOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00785                         sprintf(errmsg,
00786                                 "ioctl GROUP_LOCK of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00787                                 filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00788                         FAIL(errmsg);
00789                 }
00790 
00791                 /* second group lock on same fd, same gid */
00792                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_LOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00793                         if (errno != EINVAL) {
00794                                 sprintf(errmsg, "Double GROUP lock failed "
00795                                         "with errno %d instead of EINVAL\n",
00796                                         errno);
00797                                 FAIL(errmsg);
00798                         }
00799                 } else {
00800                         FAIL("Taking second GROUP lock on same fd succeed\n");
00801                 }
00802 
00803                 /* second group lock on same fd, different gid */
00804                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_LOCK, gid + 1)) == -1) {
00805                         if (errno != EINVAL) {
00806                                 sprintf(errmsg, "Double GROUP lock with "
00807                                         "different gid failed with errno %d "
00808                                         "instead of EINVAL\n", errno);
00809                                 FAIL(errmsg);
00810                         }
00811                 } else {
00812                         FAIL("Taking second GROUP lock on same fd, with "
00813                              "different gid, succeeded.\n");
00814                 }
00815 
00816                 /* GROUP unlock with wrong gid */
00817                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_UNLOCK, gid + 1)) == -1) {
00818                         if (errno != EINVAL) {
00819                                 sprintf(errmsg, "GROUP_UNLOCK with wrong gid "
00820                                         "failed with errno %d instead of "
00821                                         "EINVAL\n", errno);
00822                                 FAIL(errmsg);
00823                         }
00824                 } else {
00825                         FAIL("GROUP unlock with wrong gid succeed\n");
00826                 }
00827 
00828                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_UNLOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00829                         sprintf(errmsg, "ioctl GROUP_UNLOCK of file %s "
00830                                 "returned %d.", filename, rc);
00831                         FAIL(errmsg);
00832                 }
00833                 break;
00834 
00835         case 1:
00836                 /* unlock of never locked fd */
00837                 if ((rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_UNLOCK, gid)) == -1) {
00838                         if (errno != EINVAL) {
00839                                 sprintf(errmsg, "GROUP_UNLOCK on never locked "
00840                                         "fd failed with errno %d instead of "
00841                                         "EINVAL.\n", errno);
00842                                 FAIL(errmsg);
00843                         }
00844                 } else {
00845                         FAIL("GROUP unlock on never locked fd succeed\n");
00846                 }
00847                 break;
00848         }
00849 }
00850 
00851 void grouplock_file(char *name, int subtest)
00852 {
00853         int fd;
00854         int flags = O_CREAT|O_RDWR|O_SYNC|O_TRUNC;
00855         int mode = 0666;
00856 
00857         sprintf(filename, "%s/%s", testdir, name);
00858 
00859         if ((fd = open(filename, flags, mode)) == -1) {
00860                 sprintf(errmsg, "open of file %s: (%d) %s.\n",
00861                         filename, errno, strerror(errno));
00862                 FAIL(errmsg);
00863         }
00864 
00865         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00866 
00867         switch (subtest) {
00868         case 1:
00869                 grouplock_test1(filename, fd, READ, IOCTL);
00870                 break;
00871         case 2:
00872                 grouplock_test1(filename, fd, READ, CLOSE);
00873                 break;
00874         case 3:
00875                 grouplock_test1(filename, fd, WRITE, IOCTL);
00876                 break;
00877         case 4:
00878                 grouplock_test1(filename, fd, WRITE, CLOSE);
00879                 break;
00880         case 5:
00881                 grouplock_test2(filename, fd, READ, IOCTL);
00882                 break;
00883         case 6:
00884                 grouplock_test2(filename, fd, READ, CLOSE);
00885                 break;
00886         case 7:
00887                 grouplock_test2(filename, fd, WRITE, IOCTL);
00888                 break;
00889         case 8:
00890                 grouplock_test2(filename, fd, WRITE, CLOSE);
00891                 break;
00892         case 9:
00893                 grouplock_nonblock_test(filename, fd);
00894                 break;
00895         case 10:
00896                 grouplock_errorstest(filename, fd);
00897                 break;
00898         case 11:
00899                 grouplock_test3(filename, fd);
00900                 break;
00901         case 12:
00902                 grouplock_test4(filename, fd);
00903                 break;
00904         default:
00905                 sprintf(errmsg, "wrong subtest number %d (should be <= %d)",
00906                         subtest, LPGL_TEST_ITEMS);
00907                 FAIL(errmsg);
00908         }
00909 
00910         close(fd);
00911 
00912         if (rank == 0)
00913                 unlink(filename);
00914 
00915         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00916 }
00917 
00918 void parallel_grouplock(void)
00919 {
00920         char teststr[16];
00921         int i;
00922 
00923         if (only_test) {
00924                 sprintf(teststr, "subtest %d", only_test);
00925                 begin(teststr);
00926                 grouplock_file("parallel_grouplock", only_test);
00927                 end(teststr);
00928         } else {
00929                 for (i = 1; i <= LPGL_TEST_ITEMS; i++) {
00930                         sprintf(teststr, "subtest %d", i);
00931                         begin(teststr);
00932                         grouplock_file("parallel_grouplock", i);
00933                         end(teststr);
00934                 }
00935         }
00936 }
00937 
00938 void usage(char *proc)
00939 {
00940         int i;
00941 
00942         if (rank == 0) {
00943                 printf("Usage: %s [-h] -d <testdir> [-n <num>]\n", proc);
00944                 printf("           [-t <num>] [-v] [-V #] [-g]\n");
00945                 printf("\t-h: prints this help message\n");
00946                 printf("\t-d: the directory in which the tests will run\n");
00947                 printf("\t-n: repeat test # times\n");
00948                 printf("\t-t: run a particular test #\n");
00949                 printf("\t-v: increase the verbositly level by 1\n");
00950                 printf("\t-V: select a specific verbosity level\n");
00951                 printf("\t-g: debug mode\n");
00952         }
00953 
00954         MPI_Initialized(&i);
00955         if (i) MPI_Finalize();
00956         exit(0);
00957 }
00958 
00959 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00960 {
00961         int i, iterations = 1, c;
00962 
00963         setbuf(stdout, 0);
00964         setbuf(stderr, 0);
00965 
00966         /* Check for -h parameter before MPI_Init so the binary can be
00967            called directly, without, for instance, mpirun */
00968         for (i = 1; i < argc; ++i) {
00969                 if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-h") || !strcmp(argv[i], "--help"))
00970                         usage(argv[0]);
00971         }
00972 
00973         MPI_Init(&argc, &argv);
00974         MPI_Comm_rank(MPI_COMM_WORLD, &rank);
00975         MPI_Comm_size(MPI_COMM_WORLD, &size);
00976 
00977         /* Parse command line options */
00978         while (1) {
00979                 c = getopt(argc, argv, "d:ghn:t:vV:");
00980                 if (c == -1)
00981                         break;
00982 
00983                 switch (c) {
00984                 case 'd':
00985                         testdir = optarg;
00986                         break;
00987                 case 'g':
00988                         debug = 1;
00989                         break;
00990                 case 'h':
00991                         usage(argv[0]);
00992                         break;
00993                 case 'n':
00994                         iterations = atoi(optarg);
00995                         break;
00996                 case 't':
00997                         only_test = atoi(optarg);
00998                         break;
00999                 case 'v':
01000                         verbose += 1;
01001                         break;
01002                 case 'V':
01003                         verbose = atoi(optarg);
01004                         break;
01005                 }
01006         }
01007 
01008         if (rank == 0)
01009                 printf("%s is running with %d task(es) %s\n",
01010                        argv[0], size, debug ? "in DEBUG mode" : "\b\b");
01011 
01012         if (size < MIN_GLHOST) {
01013                 fprintf(stderr, "Error: "
01014                         "%d tasks run, but should be at least %d tasks to run "
01015                         "the test!\n", size, MIN_GLHOST);
01016                 MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 2);
01017         }
01018 
01019         if (testdir == NULL && rank == 0) {
01020                 fprintf(stderr, "Please specify a test directory! "
01021                         "(\"%s -h\" for help)\n",
01022                        argv[0]);
01023                 MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 2);
01024         }
01025 
01026         lp_gethostname();
01027 
01028         for (i = 0; i < iterations; ++i) {
01029                 if (rank == 0)
01030                         printf("%s: Running test #%s(iter %d)\n",
01031                                timestamp(), argv[0], i);
01032 
01033                 parallel_grouplock();
01034                 MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
01035         }
01036 
01037         if (rank == 0) {
01038                 printf("%s: All tests passed!\n", timestamp());
01039         }
01040         MPI_Finalize();
01041         return 0;
01042 }
